  • Experience with AWS

Title: ML Engineer (d/f/m)
Description:
About Us

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Berlin and Madrid, Team Taxfix is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with 500+ professionals from 45+ different nationalities, we're rich in ideas and voices. In four years, we've raised over 300 million euros in funding and helped people reclaim more than one billion euros.

Role Overview

You will work closely with product teams to understand their specific product opportunities, and where these can translate them into practical AI/ML solutions that enhance the user experience. Leveraging the tools and resources provided by our ML Platform, you'll focus on integrating ML and AI to build intelligent features within our products. This role offers an exciting opportunity to see your work directly influence the user experience and shape the future of our product landscape.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with Product Managers and Application Engineers to define technical requirements and success metrics for ML and AI-powered features.
Translate product concepts into feasible ML and AI solutions, leveraging established approaches and pre-trained models provided by the ML Platform.
Design, develop, and test models within product features, ensuring high accuracy, performance, and explainability.
Implement robust monitoring and evaluation frameworks to track model performance and identify areas for improvement.
Integrate models into production environments, working seamlessly with application developers and DevOps teams.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in relevant domains and communicate their potential impact to teams.
Document technical solutions and participate in knowledge sharing within the organization.


Qualifications


3+ years of experience in applying machine learning to solve real-world product opportunities
Strong understanding of core ML concepts, algorithms, and model development methodologies.
Experience with popular ML libraries and frameworks and familiar working with foundational AI models
Proven ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications and deliver solutions on time and within budget.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Passion for user experience and a strong desire to build products that make a positive impact and enable making tax simple


Bonus Points


Experience with specific ML domains relevant to tax, user journeys and personalization
Understanding of MLOps principles and best practices.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic wellbeing with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and rollover as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employees—because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
Dedicated relocation and visa support for those that need it.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app—and internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? We’re happy to have dogs join us in the office.


Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture below:

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyways. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't previously considered.
Show more

  • Document technical solutions and participate in knowledge sharing within the organization.

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience in applying machine learning to solve real-world product opportunities
  • Strong understanding of core ML concepts, algorithms, and model development methodologies.
  • Experience with popular ML libraries and frameworks and familiar working with foundational AI models
  • Proven ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications and deliver solutions on time and within budget.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
  • Passion for user experience and a strong desire to build products that make a positive impact and enable making tax simple

Bonus Points

  • Experience with specific ML domains relevant to tax, user journeys and personalization
  • Understanding of MLOps principles and best practices.

Why Taxfix?

  • A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
  • Holistic wellbeing with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
  • A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and rollover as flexibly as you like.
  • Employee stock options for all employees—because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
  • Dedicated relocation and visa support for those that need it.
  • 30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
  • Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
  • Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app—and internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
  • Have a four-legged friend in your life? We’re happy to have dogs join us in the office.

Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture below:

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyways. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't previously considered.

Title: Founding Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and driven Machine Learning Engineer to join an exciting AI start-up. As a Founding Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing innovative AI solutions to revolutionise regulatory affairs. You will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment from the early stages, contributing to the creation of groundbreaking products.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy machine learning models.
Design and implement scalable and efficient algorithms for data processing and analysis.
Utilize Python to develop and maintain machine learning pipelines.
Solve complex technical problems and make critical decisions on prioritising speed and attention to detail.
Continuously research and stay updated on the latest advancements in machine learning technologies.




Requirements:

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer with proficiency in Python.
Demonstrated ability to build innovative products in a fast-paced environment, preferably from the early stages.
Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
Strong belief in our mission to revolutionise the regulatory affairs industry with AI.




Why Join Us:

Be at the forefront of transforming regulatory affairs with AI technology.
Opportunity to have a significant impact and drive meaningful change in the industry.
Work in a small and ambitious team where everyone has real ownership over the product and company.
Continuous growth and learning opportunities.
Competitive compensation package with an unusual amount of equity reserved for early, full-time employees.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (mwd)
Company: HMS Analytical Software | Consulting & End-to-End Solutions for Data Science & Analytics
Description:
Berlin

deutschlandweit/remote

Heidelberg

Ulm

Berufserfahrung

Voll/Teilzeit

Unsere über 30-jährige Erfolgsgeschichte im Software Analytics-Bereich zeigt: wir sind hochspezialisierte Experten, wenn es darum geht, datengetriebene Geschäftsmodelle zu schaffen. Durch die Synthese von Data Engineering, Machine Learning und Software Engineering unterstützen wir Unternehmen dabei aus ihren Daten Mehrwerte zu generieren. Unsere über 160 Mitarbeiter treiben digitale Modernisierungen in den Branchen Manufacturing, Finance und Life Science voran und bereiten den Weg für eine Wirtschaft, die sich auf Wissen, Technik und Verantwortung stützt.

Das sind Ihre Aufgaben


Als Senior Data Scientist (mwd) wirken Sie u.a. aktiv bei der Digitalisierung von Geschäftsprozessen und Produktionsanlagen durch künstliche Intelligenz bei führenden Unternehmen mit.
Sie analysieren die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden, übersetzen diese in komplexe, analytische Fragestellungen und verzahnen alles eng mit der Informatik.
Dabei bringen Sie Ihre fachlichen Kompetenzen ein, nutzen Ihr unternehmerisches Denken und entwickeln so unsere strategischen Projekte mit hoher Wirkungsmacht weiter.
Sie lassen andere an Ihrem Wissen teilhaben – als Mentor für andere Kolleginnen und Kollegen oder in unserem bewährten Kompetenzmanagement.


Das bringen Sie mit


Mindestens guter Abschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik bzw. artverwandten Fachrichtungen oder in Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbaren naturwissenschaftlichen Studiengängen
Mehrjährige Praxiserfahrung in Data Science, Business Intelligence oder Software Engineering im Machine-Learning-Umfeld oder als Berater im Digitalisierungskontext
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einer analytischen Programmiersprache (z.B. Python, R) oder einer universellen Programmiersprache (z.B. C#, Java, C++, Rust)
Gute Kenntnisse in der Nutzung relationaler Datenbanken und SQL
Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Technologien (z.B. Azure, AWS), Big-Data-Technologien (z.B. Spark, Kafka) sowie Operationalisierungswerkzeugen (z.B. Docker, Kubernetes)
Erfahrungen in DevOps/MLOps-Prinzipien und -Tools
Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsstärke in Deutsch und Englisch - im Team und Kunden gegenüber
Neugierde und Bereitschaft zu gelegentlichen Reisen


Das bieten wir Ihnen

Mensch & Kultur: Die Gemeinschaft und der Austausch im Unternehmen werden durch vielfältige Events wie Unternehmensmittagessen, Sommerfeste, Teamevents, Unternehmenskonferenzen und Weihnachtsfeiern aktiv gefördert. Ein Welcome Day sowie ein Mentoren-Programm während der Einarbeitungszeit tragen zudem dazu bei, den Zusammenhalt innerhalb der Teams zu stärken. Zusätzlich fördern wir den Teamgeist durch eine substanzielle Gewinnbeteiligung, die auf alle Mitarbeiter verteilt wird.

Karriereentwicklung & Wissensaustausch: Die Vielfalt unserer (Kunden-)Projekte ermöglicht eine individuelle Karriereentwicklung. Verschiedenste Schulungsangebote und die Teilnahme an Fachkonferenzen fördern fachliches Wachstum. Ein jährliches Wissensbudget von 12 Tagen und Wissenszirkel unterstützen den kontinuierlichen Wissensaustausch.

Work-Life-Balance & Flexibilität: Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Arbeitszeitkonto, Mobile Office/hybrides Arbeiten, Workation-/Sabbatical-Optionen und die Möglichkeit Hunde mit ins Büro zu bringen, sind nur ein Teil unseres Angebots für Flexibilität und Lebensqualität. Auch in kritischen Situationen unterstützen wir mit bis zu 5 bezahlten Abwesenheitstagen, um sich um pflegebedürftige oder kranke Familienmitglieder zu kümmern.

Finanzielle Vorteile: Mitarbeiter profitieren von unseren Zuschüssen für: Kinderbetreuung, Essen und Sport, betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit unverbindlicher Beratung, Deutschlandticket für nachhaltiges Reisen.

Gesundheit & Wohlbefinden: Verschiedene Gesundheitsmaßnahmen wie bewegte Pausen, Ergonomieberatung, Grippeimpfung und Augenarztuntersuchung fördern das Wohlbefinden und die langfristige Gesundheit der Mitarbeiter. Gesunde Snacks und Getränke gehören selbstverständlich ebenfalls zu unserem Angebot. Und um auch die soziale Interaktion zu stärken, haben wir Hobby- und Sportgruppen etabliert, welche nicht nur den lockeren Austausch, sondern auch den Zusammenhalt im Team stärken.

Soziale Verantwortung & Nachhaltigkeit: Durch die HuManS-Stiftung streben wir danach, einen positiven Beitrag zur Gesellschaft zu leisten. Unsere Klimainitiative und das Umweltprogramm setzen sich engagiert für nachhaltige Unternehmenspraktiken ein.

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung als Senior Data Scientist (mwd) in Voll- oder Teilzeit (mind. 80%)!

Leonie Höhl

Senior Personalreferentin

Kai Brodmann

Geschäftsbereichsleiter Data Science und Business Intelligence

Title: AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring an AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

The people who love this role are software engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. They are are developers who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training. Ubuntu is used by pretty much every enterprise in the world, in every industry. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the open source technology landscape and develop your business technology insights. You will see first hand in various industries how Linux - and Ubuntu in particular - is shaping innovation and changing the world for the better.

This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads. We are specifically looking for people interested in solving the most difficult problems in modern data architectures. Training LLMs on multiple K8s clusters deployed on a hybrid cloud infrastructure with GPU sharing across multiple teams? Processing 10M events in real time for financial transactions? Object detection on 10k parallel 4K video streams? These are the problems we solve day to day.

Location: Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.

What your day will look like

The global Field Engineering team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.


Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, and Spark
Deliver solutions either on-premise or in public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro and AI/ML capabilities to prospective and current clients
Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap
Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets
Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events and 25% to customer meetings


What we are looking for in you


Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Experience in data engineering, MLOps, or big data solutions deployment
Experience with a relevant programming language, like Python, R, or Rust.
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
Intermediate level Python programming skills
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments
Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings


What you'll learn


Architect and deploy AI/ML infrastructures, data processing pipelines and multi-cluster distributed training
Wide range of open source applications and skills
Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses
Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d) Mathematical Optimization
Description:
Entwickeln, was morgen wichtig ist.

Wie werden wir in Zukunft miteinander kommunizieren, Energien sinnvoll nutzen und uns fortbewegen? Wir können an den Antworten zusammenarbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorien in die Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken.

Als Data Scientist (w/m/d) Factory Digitalization stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife jetzt die Chance und werde Teil unseres globalen Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Wir freuen uns darüber, wenn du dein Talent bei uns einbringst!

Verändere mit uns die Welt von morgen.


Digital Factory: Du identifizierst Potentiale zur Automatisierung und Optimierung gemeinsam mit Kollegen und Kolleginnen aus den Fachbereichen Manufacturing, Finance und dem Supply Chain Management/ Logistik, bei denen der Einsatz von Data Science einen Mehrwert für unser Geschäft darstellt.
Mathematische Optimierung: Dein Fokus liegt auf der Entwicklung und Implementierung mathematischer Optimierungsmodelle und Heuristiken für spezielle logistische Fragstellungen.
Data Analysis und Digitale Transformation: Du analysierst und interpretierst Daten aus unserer innovativen Dateninfrastruktur zu möglichen Prozess-, Produkt- oder Qualitätsverbesserungen und bist ein aktiver Bestandteil der digitalen Transformation für unsere Fertigungsstandorte.
Künstliche Intelligenz (KI): Du stellst die Funktionsfähigkeit deiner Modelle in der Praxis unter Beweis, um unsere Geschäftsabläufe zu optimieren.
Web-Applikationen/Cloud Computing: Du entwickelst Web-Applikationen zu deinen Use-Cases in unserer Cloud-Umgebung und verbesserst diese kontinuierlich gemeinsam mit uns weiter.
Project Lead und Cross-Functional Teams: Du verantwortest die erfolgreiche Entwicklung und Implementierung deiner Use Cases mit cross-funktionalen, agilen Fachabteilungs- und IT-Teams, um skalierbare Erfolgsgeschichten zu liefern.


Dein Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".


Du besitzt einen fachlich relevanten Bachelorabschluss oder höher im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Ingenieurwesen, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik oder einer verwanden Fachrichtung.
Du bringst bereits mehrjährig Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Science und/oder Computer Science mit, vorzugsweise im industriellen Fertigungsumfeld.
Du zeichnest Dich durch gute Kenntnisse in C#, Python und SQL aus.
Du bist mit der mathematischen Modellierung (Operations-Research) von logistischen Fragestellungen und den damit gängigen Lösungsverfahren vertraut und bringst idealerweise Erfahrung im Bereich Machine Learning und Deep Learning mit.
Du kannst Erfahrungen und Technologiekenntnisse im Cloud-Computing Bereich, wie z.B. mit Microsoft Azure, AWS oder GCP vorweisen.
Du besitzt die Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen zu erfassen, detailliert zu analysieren und zu modellieren sowie die gewonnenen Erkenntnisse einem nicht-technischen Publikum verständlich zu präsentieren.
Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab.


Was wir bieten.


Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
Ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du dich mit deiner ganzen Persönlichkeit einbringen kannst und dich als Teil von Siemens fühlst
30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für dich und deine Familie ermöglichen
Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
Vielfältige Gesundheitsangebote
Barrierefreie Standorte
Und viele weitere Benefits hier


Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie persönliche Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass du willst: Bewirb dich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

https://new.siemens.com/ - wenn du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Blinkist connects people with powerful ideas from leading authors and experts to broaden perspectives, gain knowledge, and spark understanding in all areas of their life, both personal and professional.

Used by over 28 million people worldwide, Blinkist distills the key ideas from the most relevant, impactful books and podcasts. These can be read or listened to in 15-minute summaries, that we call Blinks.

Together with Go1, our parent brand, who gives organizations and their employees access to the largest curated e-learning library on the planet, we're on a mission to reach one billion learners as we unlock positive potential through a love of learning. ✨

About The Role

As a Data Scientist specializing in marketing, you will leverage your expertise to enhance our marketing strategies through sophisticated attribution and ROI models. Your role will involve analyzing vast datasets to refine content targeting, enhance the precision of marketing ROI forecasts, and build robust systems that automate and streamline marketing operations. If you thrive in dynamic environments and are passionate about creating solutions that tackle diverse marketing-related challenges, this position offers the opportunity to make a significant impact in shaping our marketing efforts.

A few important notes about this position:


You can work in a hybrid setup from our offices in Berlin or Paris, or fully remote within Germany, France or the UK. We can only hire candidates who are based in these countries and already have the legal right to work there.
Check out the interview process for this position here: https://jobs.blinkist.com/egf


What You Will Do


Review the performance of existing attribution and eROI systems to identify improvement opportunities
Develop ML-models to support marketing automation
Conduct exploratory data analyses to find actionable insights
Visualize and document your work


What You Need To Have


You have 4+ years of experience working with machine learning models
You have 2+ years of experience working with marketing-related challenges and data
You've worked with the Python ecosystem: Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, Jupyter, Tensorflow
You are fluent in SQL
You have good communication skills and communicate confidently in English
You're a great fit to our team by bringing humour, passion and a drive for ownership


Great to Haves


You have good knowledge of software architecture and design patterns
You have experience working with AWS
You have experience working with DBT


Why Blinkist/Go1

Our unique culture of empowerment, mutual respect, and transparency has always been our defining characteristic. We support each other and carve out opportunities for every individual to develop and grow. We strongly believe that diversity powers innovation, thus we celebrate and support our differences, providing equal opportunities for employment and career growth. We embrace a flexible, remote ways of working that support different needs and lifestyles.

🌟 Blinkist is proud to have been selected by LinkedIn as one of the Top 25 Startups in Germany. Glassdoor and Kununu ratings put us amongst Berlin's top employers.

These are some of our most valued benefits:


Competitive incentive plan in addition to salary
Employee Stock Option Plan
Flexible approach to work
Monthly work from home or transport reimbursement
One time work from home office set up budget
Unlimited access to the Go1 Learning Hub, and mentorship program
Professional development fund
Volunteer leave to give back to the community
30 PTO days + Wellbeing days + Learning Days
Flexible public holidays - take the days off that are important to you, swap out the ones that are not
Family planning & parental leave, plus support for parents returning to work
Wellness initiatives and an Employee Assistance Program


If you choose to join our team in Berlin, you'll have access to our modern office space in Neukölln and enjoy healthy plant-based meals prepared fresh every day by our very own chef. 🥑

Apply Now

If we've captured your interest and you want to take part in changing the world through the power of ideas – apply now and tell us what got you excited about this opportunity.

We look forward to hearing from you! ☀️

🔎 Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised folks tend to only apply when they check every box. If you think you have what it takes, even if you don't meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Information on how we process your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy: Blinkist Privacy Policy (English) / Blinkist Privacy Policy (German)

Title: Fullstack Data Scientist/Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
Role: Fullstack Data Scientist/Computer Vision Engineer

Salary: €65,000-€85,000

Location: Germany Remote




About the job

An exciting start-up in the Solar & Construction industry are looking for a Data Scientist/Computer Vision Engineer to join their expanding team.




They are a SaaS organisation that provides an AI-powered information procession cloud program for roofers and solar planners in Germany.




As a Data Scientist/Computer Vision Engineer, you will work on advanced technologies and use the latest cutting-edge technologies in computer vision, drone-based 2D to 3D object detection, and automatic geometry reconstruction.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with our drone technology team to integrate machine learning models into the drone platform.
Work with cross-functional teams to address data-driven business challenges.
Handle data preprocessing, model training, deployment, and monitoring.
Construct end-to-end machine learning pipelines using GCP, Python, Argo, PyTorch, MLflow, and other relevant tools.
Develop and deploy computer vision algorithms for detecting 2D to 3D objects using data collected from flying drones.




Requirements

3-4 years of experience in data science and machine learning, including exposure to Computer Vision and Deep Learning models.
STEM background.




Nice to Have:

Experience in software engineering, including proficiency in Python.
Previous experience in the construction or Energy industry.
Experience with Python, GCP, VertexAI, Pytorch, Conda, Mlflow, Github, and Argoworkflows.




If you think the above is of interest, please apply now or send your CV to sean.rozen@opusrs.com.

Title: Principal Data Scientist - Machine Learning (f/m/d)
Description:
Almedia helps leading brands in the digital space to acquire new customers. Users can find and test the latest games, apps, and products for rewards via our platforms.

With more than 20 million users since our launch in 2020, Almedia's Freecash.com is one of the fastest-growing providers and a leader in our industry. Our mission is to provide a win-win experience for both users and advertisers.

We are looking for a Principal Data Scientist to join our rapidly growing team in Berlin.

Responsibilities:


Lead the establishment of the organization’s data science discipline and take ownership of the company’s data science strategy.
Identify high-value ML business opportunities and work with both business and technical stakeholders to realize business benefit.
Deliver and deploy end-to-end machine-learning models, build measurement plans, learn and iterate to drive results.
Apply a solid statistical mindset and best practices, in the process of model development, deployment, and evolution.
Deeply understand the data and customer and business problems, in order to more closely align machine-learning model objectives and develop the best features and models to predict them.
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, business developers, and user acquisition channel managers.


Requirements:


6+ years of work experience, with at least 4 years of industry experience in developing machine-learning models, and ideally leading projects and small teams.
Expertise in building, deploying, measuring, and maintaining machine learning models to address real-world problems.
Strong statistical knowledge (A/B tests, probability, regression).
A combination of Python, SQL, and cloud experience is essential.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner. Preference for candidates with backgrounds in ad tech, gaming, or marketing.


Benefits:


An opportunity to work in an innovative, high-growth startup that has been profitable from day one.
A fast-paced and inclusive work environment in a team of highly motivated professionals.
Continuous learning and development opportunities.
Flexible work arrangements and a modern office space in the heart of Berlin.
Work from abroad policy


Almedia is an equal opportunity employer, we embrace and celebrate diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
Show more
HTML:
Almedia helps leading brands in the digital space to acquire new customers. Users can find and test the latest games, apps, and products for rewards via our platforms.

With more than 20 million users since our launch in 2020, Almedia's Freecash.com is one of the fastest-growing providers and a leader in our industry. Our mission is to provide a win-win experience for both users and advertisers.

We are looking for a Principal Data Scientist to join our rapidly growing team in Berlin.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead the establishment of the organization’s data science discipline and take ownership of the company’s data science strategy.
  • Identify high-value ML business opportunities and work with both business and technical stakeholders to realize business benefit.
  • Deliver and deploy end-to-end machine-learning models, build measurement plans, learn and iterate to drive results.
  • Apply a solid statistical mindset and best practices, in the process of model development, deployment, and evolution.
  • Deeply understand the data and customer and business problems, in order to more closely align machine-learning model objectives and develop the best features and models to predict them.
  • Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, business developers, and user acquisition channel managers.

Requirements:

  • 6+ years of work experience, with at least 4 years of industry experience in developing machine-learning models, and ideally leading projects and small teams.
  • Expertise in building, deploying, measuring, and maintaining machine learning models to address real-world problems.
  • Strong statistical knowledge (A/B tests, probability, regression).
  • A combination of Python, SQL, and cloud experience is essential.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner. Preference for candidates with backgrounds in ad tech, gaming, or marketing.

Benefits:

  • An opportunity to work in an innovative, high-growth startup that has been profitable from day one.
  • A fast-paced and inclusive work environment in a team of highly motivated professionals.
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities.
  • Flexible work arrangements and a modern office space in the heart of Berlin.
  • Work from abroad policy

Almedia is an equal opportunity employer, we embrace and celebrate diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Delivery
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help us improve Bolt Food’s delivery process.

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 45+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building models to estimate the food preparation time at various stages of the order, such as before and after the order has been accepted. You will also be developing complex demand forecasting pipelines for our Bolt Market dark stores. You will be involved in creating simulations to understand the impact of varying market conditions on our business metrics.

Your daily adventures will include:


Working with a technical stack consisting of Python, Docker, SageMaker, Airflow, Spark, Presto
Solving real world problems using gradient boosted trees, mathematical optimisation, time series forecasting, recommender systems, deep learning and more
Understanding the core needs of our Delivery businesses and translating their problems to technical specifications
Handling the entire lifecycle from exploratory queries and notebook prototypes to a working machine learning model or other automation that might be serving thousands of calls per second in production
Leveraging our in-house model lifecycle platform that allow you to launch new projects in a matter of days
Working in product feature teams together with data analysts, product managers and software engineers
Discussing the problems and technical innovations within the broader data science team that provides a pool of peers and mentors
Deploy and validate solutions for millions of users, enabling fast feedback and measurable added value to customers
Using optimisation techniques for dispatching, demand/supply balancing to minimise the delivery time of our orders
Building recommender systems and rankers to provide the best ordering experience to our clients



About you:


Industry experience in data science and machine learning (5+ years recommended)
Awareness of both business and technical aspects of data science
Experience in Python programming, including libraries like Pandas, Numpy, sklearn, OR-tools
Understanding and practical experience with statistical hypothesis testing
Proactive mindset, willingness to take initiative and work with little supervision
Hands-on experience with most used methods for dimensionality reduction, clustering algorithms, rankers, regressors, classifiers, etc (PCA, DBSCAN, Spectral Clustering, gradient boosted trees, deep neural networks, SVM, linear/logistic regression, ranking models and others)
Enthusiasm to collaborate with different roles in product, analytics and engineering to identify problems, explore trends and discover growth opportunities
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Track record of deploying models to production and measuring the impact
You will get extra credits for product development experience in a technology company



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (m/w/div)
Description:
Tätigkeitsbereich

Das KI-Labor bündelt KI-Expertise und KI-Talente in einer zentralen Einheit in der Stabsstelle Digitalstrategie und digitale Transformation. Als Expertenteam für KI und Anwendungsfall-Fabrik bringen wir KI in die DRV Bund und stehen allen Fachabteilungen als Ansprechpartner*in mit unserem Unterstützungs- und Beratungsangebot zur Seite. In einem stetig wachsenden interdisziplinären Team liefern wir mit Hilfe von KI-Technologien neue Lösungsansätze und leisten so Pionierarbeit für die zahlreichen Herausforderungen einer Bundesbehörde mit mehr als 26.000 Mitarbeitenden.

Ihre Aufgaben


Verantwortliches Konzeptionieren, Entwickeln und Implementieren von Data Science-Anwendungen mit einem crossfunktionalen Team und/ oder externen Dienstleistern
Durchführen komplexer Modellierungsarbeiten im Bereich des maschinellen Lernens (z.B. Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, etc.) und im Kontext GenAI (z.B. Large Language Modelle, Fine-Tuning etc.)
Visualisieren und Analysieren großer Datenmengen, z.B. zur Detektion von Bias oder Daten-Drifts
Optimieren und Warten von teil-automatisierten MLOps- und DevOps-Prozessen
Enges Zusammenarbeiten mit den Product Ownern und IT-Spezialisten zur Gewährung reibungsloser Prozesse und zuverlässiger Resultate
Strategisches und fachliches Mitgestalten der hausweiten Technologielandschaft im Sinne der Weiterentwicklung der DRV Bund zu einer KI-versierten Organisation
Unterstützen bei der fachlichen Entwicklung der juniorigen Kolleg*innen


Ihr Profil


Abgeschlossene Hochschulbildung (Bachelor, Diplom FH) mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt; idealerweise der Studienrichtung MINT (Mathematik, Informatik, Naturwissenschaften oder Technik) oder der Sozial- bzw. Wirtschaftswissenschaften
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Analyse großer Datenmengen, insbesondere mit Python bzw. SQL
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Prädiktionsmodellen und Selektionsverfahren auf Basis von Routinedaten
Erste Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung von Large Language Modellen (z.B. LoRA, RAG etc.)
Praktische Erfahrungen im Umgang mit gängigen Data Science-Tools (Git, Jira, Docker, Kubernetes) und ein umfangreiches Technologieverständnis
Begeisterung für die Bereiche Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence und Geschäftsprozessautomatisierung, insbesondere im Kontext des öffentlichen Sektors (GovTech)
Proaktives Kommunikationsverhalten, ausgeprägte Kooperationsbereitschaft und vernetztes Denken in der agilen Zusammenarbeit


Wir bieten Ihnen


Wir bieten Ihnen eine interessante und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit allen Vorteilen einer großen öffentlichen Arbeitgeberin
Die Möglichkeit durch eigene Ideen die digitale Transformation der DRV Bund mitzugestalten
Vielfältige Projekte wie KIRA, in dem eine KI-basierte Anwendung für unseren Betriebsprüfdienst entwickelt wird
Individuelle Fortbildungsmöglichkeiten, vielseitige Schulungsangebote und die Teilnahme an Fachkonferenzen fördern fachliches Wachstum sowie Communities of Practice (CoP) unterstützen den kontinuierlichen Wissensaustausch
Eine hervorragende Aussicht aus dem 16. Stock des Silberturms über den Dächern Berlins am Hohenzollerndamm; mindestens ein Tag Präsenz pro Woche
Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf durch flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle sowie der Möglichkeit der Arbeit im Homeoffice


Weitere Informationen

Zur Besetzung der Position werden wir mit den qualifiziertesten Bewerber*innen ein Auswahlgespräch führen. Bestandteil des Auswahlverfahrens wird eine Arbeitsprobe in Form einer Programmieraufgabe in Python sein.

Vorteile





30 Urlaubstage bei 5-Tage-Woche





Jahressonderzahlungen und vermögenswirksame Leistungen


Unbefristete Stelle
Herausforderungen


Ansprechpartner*in

Carolin Gbur

Recruiterin

E-Mail: carolin.gbur@drv-bund.de

Tel.: 030 865-32263

Diese Stellenausschreibung bezieht sich auf einen Bereich, in dem Frauen im Sinne des Bundesgleichstellungsgesetzes unterrepräsentiert sind. Die Deutsche Rentenversicherung Bund hat sich die berufliche Förderung von Frauen zum Ziel gesetzt. Wir sehen daher Bewerbungen von Frauen mit besonderem Interesse entgegen.

Menschen mit einer Schwerbehinderung oder ihnen Gleichgestellte im Sinne von


2 Abs. 2 und 3 SGB IX werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt. Begrüßt werden Bewerbungen von Menschen aller Nationalitäten.

Title: AI Engineer - Freelance
Description:
Job Title: AI Engineer

Client: Financial Services

Location: Berlin (remote)

Duration: 12 months initially

Language: German/English




Main purpose of the role:

• Expand AI innovation and delivery capacities for that business

• Develop data science and data engineering prototypes

• General continuous integration and development

• Create, craft, and bring to life generative AI-driven solutions

• Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to gather, refine, and prepare data

• Enhance the precision, efficiency, and scalability of generative

• AI offerings Implement generative AI models for operational use

• Assess the effectiveness of generative AI solutions and establish pathways for ongoing enhancement




Who am I looking for:

Practical Experience:

Possess 3 years of hands-on expertise in AI and ML, with an inaugural foray into Generative AI, preferably within leading tech firms and start-up environments.

AI Proficiency: Demonstrate adeptness with the Generative AI technology stack for tackling practical challenges, such as:

Executing end-to-end Machine Learning projects

Utilizing prevalent models (both proprietary and open source)

Implementing data pipelines (e.g., Databricks)

Operating with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone)

Leveraging orchestrators (e.g., LangChain)

Utilizing cloud services (e.g., Azure)




FINANCIAL SERVICES / CORPORATE EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We are looking for a mid/senior Python Developer

Responsibilities


Maintenance and development of the backend of an e-commerce application based on Django Rest Framework
Writing unit tests for new functionalities
Delivering readable and transparent code
Building dashboards based on SQL queries and processing the results
Direct contact with the client


Requirements


Minimum 3 years of experience working with Python
Knowledge of Django, Django Rest Framework, Docker, Docker-compose, relational databases (e.g. PostgreSQL), Flask, Redis, Celery, postgresql
English at least B2
Understanding the right patterns and algorithms
Practical analytical skills
Nice to have: Kubernetes, graphql, AWS / Google Cloud as well as Agile / SCRUM / Kanban


We Offer


B2B contract type
Full-time job
Remote and flexible working hours

Title: Python Developer (m/f/d)
Description:
WHITEvoid is an art and design studio. Our work spans a wide range of cutting-edge projects and scales. From architecture, interiors, and light installations to interactive exhibits and custom-made applications, our architectonic designs realize complex, unique ideas and adorn clubs, shops, exhibitions, shows, and more worldwide.




Our team comprises specialists in architecture, product design, event technology, and mechanical, electronics, and software engineering. Driven by technology, innovation, and experimentation, we dare to think big and push the boundaries of complexity and beauty in every project.




Our house brand KINETIC LIGHTS is the leading specialist in kinetic lighting. For more than fifteen years our designs and products have earned awards and worldwide recognition for delivering professionally engineered lighting equipment.







YOUR TASKS:

Develop and maintain our in-house control software for the KINETIC LIGHTS event automation system
Adapt and extend the Python-based backend of the software
Integrate the backend with UI components built in TouchDesigner
Manage data structures in Python
Work closely with our TouchDesigner development team, who focus more on content programming, show-delivery, UI, and frontend development
Collaborate with firmware and hardware engineers on testing KINETIC LIGHTS products
Cooperate with our manufacturing and technical planning teams
Provide off-site support for ongoing projects
Create and maintain technical documentation







YOU BRING:

Strong proficiency in Python programming with experience in application building, software architecture, and UI frameworks
Understanding of general object-oriented programming principles and design patterns
At least a basic familiarity with C++ programming
Proficiency in vector and matrix mathematic, e.g. transformations of coordinate spaces
Experience with network protocols, e.g. UDP, TCP, and OSC
Solid understanding of core computer graphics concepts and 3D pipelines
Experience using git for version control of software development projects
Adaptability to a dynamic project environment
A willingness to learn new tools, technologies, and concepts, especially TouchDesigner
A strong team player mentality with a proactive attitude and a willingness to share knowledge and support colleagues
Excellent communication skills in English. You do not need to speak German for this role!







WE OFFER:

Exceptional, challenging and unique international projects
Participation in the ongoing establishment of DARK MATTER, a new location for art, technology and events
A highly motivated, international team and a friendly, open-minded working environment - we stand for openness and diversity!
Working independently, flat hierarchies and the opportunity to contribute your own ideas
Substantial discount on Urban Sports Club memberships
Free German lessons online or at a centrally located school
A bike leasing scheme with tax benefits, insurance, maintenance, and end of lease options
Guest list allowance for our permanent exhibition and temporary events
Delicious coffee and other drinks and snacks for free
Team events, such as BBQs, summer parties and a Christmas party
A modern studio right on the Spree in East Berlin with great leisure activities nearby







HOW TO APPLY:

Please send us your digital application including CV, salary expectations and preferred start date by email to jobs@whitevoid.com

Show more

  • Adapt and extend the Python-based backend of the software
  • Integrate the backend with UI components built in TouchDesigner
  • Manage data structures in Python
  • Work closely with our TouchDesigner development team, who focus more on content programming, show-delivery, UI, and frontend development
  • Collaborate with firmware and hardware engineers on testing KINETIC LIGHTS products
  • Cooperate with our manufacturing and technical planning teams
  • Provide off-site support for ongoing projects
  • Create and maintain technical documentation



YOU BRING:

  • Strong proficiency in Python programming with experience in application building, software architecture, and UI frameworks
  • Understanding of general object-oriented programming principles and design patterns
  • At least a basic familiarity with C++ programming
  • Proficiency in vector and matrix mathematic, e.g. transformations of coordinate spaces
  • Experience with network protocols, e.g. UDP, TCP, and OSC
  • Solid understanding of core computer graphics concepts and 3D pipelines
  • Experience using git for version control of software development projects
  • Adaptability to a dynamic project environment
  • A willingness to learn new tools, technologies, and concepts, especially TouchDesigner
  • A strong team player mentality with a proactive attitude and a willingness to share knowledge and support colleagues
  • Excellent communication skills in English. You do not need to speak German for this role!



WE OFFER:

  • Exceptional, challenging and unique international projects
  • Participation in the ongoing establishment of DARK MATTER, a new location for art, technology and events
  • A highly motivated, international team and a friendly, open-minded working environment - we stand for openness and diversity!
  • Working independently, flat hierarchies and the opportunity to contribute your own ideas
  • Substantial discount on Urban Sports Club memberships
  • Free German lessons online or at a centrally located school
  • A bike leasing scheme with tax benefits, insurance, maintenance, and end of lease options
  • Guest list allowance for our permanent exhibition and temporary events
  • Delicious coffee and other drinks and snacks for free
  • Team events, such as BBQs, summer parties and a Christmas party
  • A modern studio right on the Spree in East Berlin with great leisure activities nearby



HOW TO APPLY:

Please send us your digital application including CV, salary expectations and preferred start date by email to jobs@whitevoid.com

Title: Senior Data Scientist
HTML:
A software development company is looking for a talented, long-term Data Scientist. 

The company is a team of experts providing analytical services to healthcare clients. You will join an international team of first class professionals who are passionate to create products that improve quality of medical services. 

We have the highest expectations in the industry regarding your ability to deliver high quality, performant, scalable, clean, and tested software. 

Requirements:


  • strong analytical skills (good statistics is a must);
  • broad and adaptable ML scope: experience in versatile projects/different industries - ASR, CV, NLP, RL, medtech etc.;
  • strong understanding of classic ML tools, as well as DL tools (pytorch or tensorflow);
  • project-oriented mindset;
  • strong knowledge of Python (beyond Jupyter notebooks);
  • Robust SQL expertise (SELECT * is not enough).


Nice to have:


  • Google Cloud Platform;
  • Experience in life science/medtech is a big plus;
  • Experience with Wandb, MLFlow, Airflow etc;
  • Intermediate (B2 and higher) English is a plus (at least, you should be able to have written conversations with stakeholders).


Benefits: 


  • Flexible working hours; 
  • Remote work; 
  • Interesting projects to work on; 
  • Paid vacations.


- remote

Title: Generative AI Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (ALL LEVELS WELCOME)

Location: Berlin Hybrid

Salary: Up to 100k




🚀 Unleash Your Potential in Entertainment Tech! 🎬




Ready to dive into the dynamic world of entertainment tech, leaving academia behind? We're seeking a passionate and innovative Data Science and Machine Learning Expert to join our team and propel our movie industry tools to new heights!







🚀 What We Need from You:




- Passion for machine learning and data science, with a solutions engineering focus.

- Prefer delivering business results and have an entrepreneurial mindset

- System thinker with an intuitive understanding.

- Commitment to constant learning, delivering results, and creating value.




🚀 What You'll Do:




- Leverage years of data engineering excellence and cutting-edge tech.

- Iterate with practical tech (Python, Pytorch, Snowflake, Tensorflow).

- Build speedy prototypes based on smart assumptions.

- Tackle optimization problems through various methodologies.

- Knowledge on Reccommendation Systems




💫 What We Offer You:




- Environment free from boring structures and superficial perks.

- Permission-less culture for focused value delivery.

- Commitment to meaningful work, personal growth, and impact.

- Trust, a no-nonsense attitude, and a flexible hybrid work environment.

- Support for achieving personal and professional goals.

-Unlimited Holiday Days!




🎥 Media Enthusiasts Welcome!




Passionate about film? We want to hear from you! Don't stress about missing some hard skills – we hire for attitude, values, and personality. Join us in shaping the future of entertainment intelligence! 💻🌟

Title: Scientist - Data Reference Substances (m/f/d)
Description:
JOIN THE TEAM

In Global Business Services, we support BASF's divisions with a cross-functional network and offer modern solutions tailored to the needs of the business. As a specialized service unit we ensure a high level of customer orientation and we design our services to be cooperative, efficient and future-oriented.


Responsibilities

Support our team Master Data Reference Substances at the earliest possible date and ensure a high quality of our services in the area of product safety, reference substance management and maintenance. This position is initially limited to 2 years.


You act as a the contact person for a large number of BASF-internal customers for the provision of EHS-relevant data in our SAP system.
In addition, you provide our customers with new phrases, the status of registration of chemicals and new reference substances with an initial data package in our SAP systems.
You are the contact person for our external data supplier 3E and are jointly responsible for the correct provision of data in our SAP systems.
You coordinate closely with internal departments and specialists and continuously monitor quality assurance measures.
Last but not least, you support the development and implementation of new processes in the area of Product Safety - Regulatory Services.




Qualifications


degree in chemistry, food chemistry, biochemistry or a comparable qualification
professional experience in the field of chemicals legislation, especially in UN GHS, CLP and REACH
proficient with Microsoft Excel, experience with SAP modules EHS; knowledge of managing chemical regulatory data in SAP systems is an advantage
high IT affinity, especially with regard to analyzing and processing of data volumes
excellent communication skills in German and English
ability to work in a team and customer orientation
creative approaches to solutions and strong adaptability in a dynamic environment




Benefits


30 days of paid vacation, special leave and sabbatical options.
Location-independent work models with defined days of presence in Berlin and place of residence in Germany.
Work mobile from other EU countries for up to six weeks.
Modern sustainable office building in Berlin-Prenzlauer Berg with flexible working options, rooftop terrace and cafeteria for innovative and team-focused collaboration.
Team and company events in which we celebrate our achievements and live up our team spirit.




About Us

Do you have any questions about the application process or the position? Please reach out to: Amelie Solveig Brueggen, amelie.brueggen@basf.com.

First information about our application process can be found here: http://on.basf.com/applicationprocess.

As an international service hub, the BASF Services Europe GmbH bundles a wide range of services for the BASF Group throughout Europe. In the heart of Berlin, we combine expertise in the areas of finance, HR, supply chain, procurement, product safety and IT. We focus on digital and customer-focused solutions, to create services for future. Learn more about us and our career opportunities at basf.com/servicehub-berlin.

At BASF, the chemistry is right.

Because we are counting on innovative solutions, on sustainable actions, and on connected thinking. And on you. Become a part of our formula for success and develop the future with us - in a global team that embraces diversity and equal opportunities irrespective of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, disability or belief.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I'm currently working with a Series A, artificial intelligence services start-up. They are building AI technologies that will be available to the masses! They are currently at an exciting stage and are looking to scale out their engineering team! The founders are made up of ex-Google, Amazon, MIT engineers and data scientists that have created the company from the ground up.




You must have:

3-5 years of professional software development experience.
Demonstrated ability to derive AI-based features from customer requirements and deliver solutions that address those needs.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks effectively.
Knowledgeable in distributed systems and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Comprehensive understanding of machine learning concepts.
Experienced with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
Skilled in utilizing REST APIs.




You must be based in CET time zone!

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
You have a passion for technology and want to make the world a greener place? Then become a changemaker (f/m/d) and join our team as Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d) at E.ON Digital Technology (EDT).

E.ON Digital Technology plays a key role in shaping the energy transition by leading E.ON’s digital transformation across Europe. We explore new paths through developing ideas, breaking new ground, making visions reality, and bringing new technologies to life. In flexible working models and teams, we deliver sustainable technology solutions to meet the energy challenges of tomorrow.

About The Team

In this position, you will be part of our Chapter Data & AI Engineering. The chapter represents all experts who deliver data and AI engineering capabilities to our product teams. These experts are organized together to enhance those functional skillsets, improve E.ON’s MLOps & AIOps tech stack and deliver a high level of data delivery & model automation.

The products you will be working on belong to our team Digital Solutions I Future Energy Home. This team develops and operates software to manage home energy devices such as photovoltaic, inverters, batteries, EV charging wall boxes, heat pumps and meters as a cloud-based solution for our central and local units so they can rollout those solutions to the end-customers. We integrate with numerous vendors’ devices and apply centralized insights, analytics and control mechanisms for these devices.

meaningful & challenging - Your tasks


Perform complex data analysis using advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to solve critical business problems
Enhance decision-making processes in the home energy management systems domain by delivering data analysis
Design, build, and deploy predictive models and algorithms; ensure scalability and integration with existing systems and processes
Oversee data science projects from conception to deployment and their ongoing maintenance
Ensuring timely delivery and adherence to the highest quality standards
Collaborate with other departments and business units while working in cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging data



authentic & ambitious - Your profile


Advanced degree (Master’s or PhD) in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
Long-term and profound experience in data science or a related field, with a proven track record of leading successful data-driven projects
Expertise in programming languages such as Python, and experience with data manipulation tools (SQL, Pandas) and machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders and influence business decisions
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and strategies



smart & useful - Our benefits


We provide full flexibility: Do your work from home or any other place in Germany - of course including all our great offices from Hamburg to Munich. You want even more? Go on workation for up to 20 days per year within Europe.
Recharge your battery: You have 30 holidays per year plus Christmas and New Year's Eve on top. Your battery still needs charging? You can exchange parts of your salary for more holidays or you can take a sabbatical.
Your development: We grow and we want you to grow with us. Learning on the job, exchanging with others or taking part in an individual training - Our learning culture enables you to bring your personal and professional development to the next level.
Let’s empower each other: Take the opportunity to engage in our Digital Empowerment Communities for collaboration, learning, and network building.
We elevate your mobility: From car and bike leasing offers to a subsidised Deutschland-Ticket - your way is our way.
Let’s think ahead: With our company pension scheme and a great insurance package we take care of your future.
This is by far not all: We are looking forward to speaking with you about further benefits during the recruiting process.



Do you have questions?

For further information please contact Janina Gilch, janina.gilch.external@eon.com.

Please understand that for data protection reasons we can only accept applications submitted via our portal. Unfortunately, we cannot consider application documents that reach us by email or post.

Working time: Part or Full time

Company: E.ON Digital Technology GmbH

Location: Essen, Hannover, Würzburg, München, Berlin, Hamburg, Frankfurt am Main

Function area: IT/Digital; Data / IoT; Engineering

Title: Data Science Content Creator (w/m/d)
Company: DATA SCIENCE. INSTITUTE by Fabian Rappert
Description:
Du brennst für neue Technologien und digitale Trends und möchtest dein Wissen gerne mit einem interessierten Publikum teilen? Dann werde Teil unseres Product-Teams und erstelle spannenden, kreativen und qualitativ hochwertigen Video-Content für unsere Kunden. Dabei wirst du von einem erfahrenen Team begleitet, was auch die Nachbearbeitung der Videos übernimmt.

Wir sind ein 2020 geründeter, zertifizierter Bildungsträger für Erwachsenenbildung. Wir qualifizieren geeignete Interessenten für den Einstieg in IT-Berufe. Zur Vermittlung der fachlichen Basis haben wir verschiedene eLearning-Programme entwickelt, durch welche die Teilnehmenden zum Beispiel den Umgang mit Datenbanksystemen, Machine Learning und KI lernen. Wir setzen in unseren Kursmodulen auf eine enge persönliche Betreuung, denn nur so können wir sicherstellen, dass komplexe Lerninhalte gerecht vermittelt und sicher verinnerlicht werden.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Aufgaben


Contenterstellung: Du erstellst neuen und überarbeitest bestehenden Video-Content in deutscher Sprache für unsere Kursteilnehmenden.
Programmgestaltung: Du trägst dazu bei, dass unsere Weiterbildungsprogramme nahtlos und effektiv ablaufen, und bietest Unterstützung bei der Weiterentwicklung der Kursinhalte.
Bildungsunterstützung: Du unterstützt unsere Kunden kompetent bei organisatorischen und inhaltlichen Fragen auf unseren Kommunikationsplattformen Slack und Zoom.



Qualifikation


Du hast erfolgreich dein Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften (BWL, VWL), (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Ingenieurwesen, (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik oder eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs abgeschlossen
Du hast gute Python Programmierkenntnisse
Idealerweise verfügst du schon über erste Erfahrungen im Bereich Data Analytics, Data Warehousing, ETL Prozessen (SQL) oder Datenmodellierung und konntest sogar bereits erste Branchenerfahrungen sammeln
Du bist eine offene, kommunikative Person und möchtest dein Wissen gerne anderen Menschen vermitteln
Du hast Deutschkenntnisse auf muttersprachlichem Niveau



Benefits


30h in Vollzeit
30 Tage Urlaub
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Mobiles Arbeiten
Workation im EU-Ausland + Schweiz (30 Tage pro Jahr)
Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag
Ergonomischer Arbeitsplatz im Berliner Büro
Bezuschussung für berufliche Weiterbildung
Zuschuss für eine Urban Sports Mitgliedschaft



Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann schicke uns einfach deinen Lebenslauf, mehr benötigen wir nicht von dir. Falls du vorab noch offene Fragen zur Stelle oder uns klären möchtest, dann sind wir gerne unter jobs(at)institut-data-science für dich da.

Aus Gründen der leichteren Lesbarkeit haben wir uns für die männliche Schreibweise entschieden. Die abgebildeten Inhalte richten sich aber zugleich an alle Geschlechter. Mit dieser Schreibweise wollen wir niemanden ausschließen, denn bei uns ist jede Person gleichermaßen willkommen.
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Digital Waffle is proud to have partnered with a company at the forefront of the renewable energy revolution, using artificial intelligence to optimise energy production, integration, and efficiency. We're looking for a passionate Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing team and play a key role in shaping the future of sustainable energy.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with domain experts to identify renewable energy challenges where machine learning can provide solutions.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning models for tasks such as:
Solar energy forecasting
Wind turbine performance optimization
Demand response management for the power grid
Predictive maintenance for renewable energy infrastructure




Oversee the entire machine learning lifecycle, from data acquisition and pre-processing to model deployment and monitoring.
Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in machine learning for renewable energy applications.
Mentor and guide junior engineers on the team and lead recruitment of new team members.




Qualifications:

MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and their applications (supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning).
Proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models in production environments.
Experience working with big data and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
A passion for renewable energy and sustainability.




Benefits:

Be part of a mission-driven company that's making a real difference in the world.
Work on challenging and impactful projects with real-world applications.
Collaborate with a talented team of engineers and scientists.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.

Show more
HTML:
Digital Waffle is proud to have partnered with a company at the forefront of the renewable energy revolution, using artificial intelligence to optimise energy production, integration, and efficiency. We're looking for a passionate Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing team and play a key role in shaping the future of sustainable energy.


Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with domain experts to identify renewable energy challenges where machine learning can provide solutions.
  • Design, develop, and implement machine learning models for tasks such as:
  • Solar energy forecasting
  • Wind turbine performance optimization
  • Demand response management for the power grid
  • Predictive maintenance for renewable energy infrastructure


  • Oversee the entire machine learning lifecycle, from data acquisition and pre-processing to model deployment and monitoring.
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in machine learning for renewable energy applications.
  • Mentor and guide junior engineers on the team and lead recruitment of new team members.


Qualifications:

  • MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer.
  • Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and their applications (supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning).
  • Proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models in production environments.
  • Experience working with big data and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
  • A passion for renewable energy and sustainability.


Benefits:

  • Be part of a mission-driven company that's making a real difference in the world.
  • Work on challenging and impactful projects with real-world applications.
  • Collaborate with a talented team of engineers and scientists.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Opportunity to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Diconium is a specialist in the fields of data and artificial intelligence. Whether in the areas of search, social and content, personalization and analytics, data engineering or data science - our expertise helps our customers to collect the right data at the right time, to forecast services and offers and thus to make data-driven decisions. Become a part of the diconium data family and support us on our Data & AI journey!

What you can expect


Create and maintaining highly performant and scalable ML services and integrate models for different services in enterprise infrastructures.
Design, build and maintain the ML CI/CD pipeline and workflows automating data collection, data analysis, experimentation, model training, model serving and monitoring in production.
Train, evaluate and scale machine learning models.
Work in an environment with state-of-the-art technologies and frameworks to provide scalable, cost-effective and flexible high-quality solutions to our customers. Advise data science teams on scaling models.
Contribute your creativity and pioneering spirit to the further development of our machine learning architecture and the exploration of new trends.


This is what you bring along

Must Haves


3 years of relevant working experience and a suitable degree
Very proficient with Python and have experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and scikit-learn
Experience with Azure Cloud, Docker, GitHub, Terraform
Experience with MLOps, CI/CD and related tooling
Experience with ETL/ELT and data transformation frameworks (e.g. Spark) as well as storage solutions (e.g. Databricks)
Effective communication skills and fluent English


Nice To Have


Experience with Ray
Experience in data architecture and database architecture
Experience with AWS
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Campaigns
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help us improve Bolt’s Campaigns

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 45+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building models for predicting user and market behaviour under different circumstances, such as incentives, competitors' activity, and seasonality. You will work on customer segmentation: discover rider, driver, and eater segments for efficient campaign targeting. As a Data Scientist, you will be developing a system for automating promo campaigns distribution and scaling it for millions of Bolt customers. You will be engaged in designing optimal experimental setup for comparing different campaigns targeting methodologies and user behavior dynamics. You will work on uplift modelling topics to help shaping the most efficient campaign offerings.

Your daily adventures will include:


Machine learning and statistical model development and its deployment into a production environment
Setting up A/B tests, collecting, interpreting its results and communicating to stakeholders
Working closely with the Experimentation team to figure out robust design of campaigns experiments
Studying historical user behaviour data to identify opportunities for optimisation
Building models for optimal users’ discount allocation
Developing a system for automating regular promo campaign setups
Working with a technical stack consisting of Python, Docker, Presto, SageMaker, Airflow
Collaborating with data analysts, data scientists, product managers and software engineers in feature teams



About you:


Industry experience in data science and machine learning (4+ years recommended)
Practical experience setting A/B tests and interpreting results
Deep understanding the theory behind statistical hypothesis testing
Profound knowledge of statistics, probability, and causal inference
Track record of deploying models to production and measuring the impact
Strong product thinking, ability to communicate and persuade, problem-solving
Experience writing complex SQL queries
Ability to map business and product problems on data science framework
Proactive mindset, willingness to take initiative and work with little supervision
Team player with excellent communication skills
You will get extra credits for experience in modelling and successful implementation of causal inference
You will get extra credits for Ph.D. in Computer Science, statistics, or related quantitative fields, or a Master's degree with equivalent industry experience
You will get extra credits for a background in econometrics, operations research, simulation or quantitative analysis of behaviour



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.
