Title: Full Stack Developer
Description:
Intelligent City is an urban housing technology company that takes a product and platform-based approach to buildings. We combine exceptional design with mass timber construction, robotic manufacturing, and parametric software. Our mission is to build smarter and to empower people to live better. We create a new value paradigm for housing and workplace solutions that are more affordable, faster to build, consistently carbon neutral and socially resilient.

Our motto is ‘Build Smarter. Live Better. Think Change.’ If this resonates with you, we encourage you to apply to join our team and help us build a better world!

We are looking for an experienced Full Stack Developer / Software Developer to join our team and help us make a big impact in the architecture, engineering and construction (AEC) industry. Your role will be crucial for the success of our CAD software/plugin development efforts, and you'll be involved in the entire software development lifecycle, including the prototyping, development, deployment and maintenance of new and existing features, both on the front-end and back-end of our stack.

Open Positions: 1

Location: Vancouver, BC

Education & Qualifications, Required:


Post-secondary degree in in Computer Science, Engineering, or related disciplines or an equivalent combination of education and experience in a related field may substitute for education only



Skills & Experience, Required:


3 to 6 years of industry experience as software developer or full-stack developer
C#, JavaScript, Python, Json, HTML, CSS
Frameworks such as .NET Core and React
Database languages such as SQL and RDBMS schema design
Data structure file formats such as JSON and XML
Versioning control systems such as GIT and repositories hosting services such as GitHub
Knowledge of unit testing and unit testing tools
Agile software development workflows



Nice to Haves:


AEC industry web frameworks experience is a plus (Three.js, WebGL, Autodesk Forge, Rhino Compute, and others)
Background and/or experience in the AEC industry
UI/UX design concepts



The Role & Responsibilities - Full Stack Developer:


Understand and help guide the overall mission of the company's software automation
Participate in, or lead, the design and creation of scalable software to automate design and manufacturing processes
Write and help the team to write clean, functional code on the front- and back-end
Become the source of knowledge for the team for coding and testing practices
Work as part of an Agile team using a Digital Delivery Methodology
Interpret business requirements and assess change impact and effort
Implement automated unit testing with all application changes
Identify and resolve integration issues
Utilize industry best practices within our existing technology stack



Important to Mention!


This position is full-time at our Vancouver, BC Office, with the option to work 2 days from home
Willingness to commute on occasion at the Delta, BC manufacturing facility
Proof of ability to remain and work in Canada
Successful candidates may be required to submit to a background check



#ICI-01

Intelligent City (ICI) is a technology-enabled and platform-based urban housing systems company providing transformational innovation to the housing, architecture, building and construction industry. Through the convergence of design, software technology and advanced prefabrication, we combine three highly innovative paradigms that will change the value equation in architecture and urban design.

Our team is on a mission to empower people to live better, to build smarter, and to address climate change and urban housing challenges. We think change – and we are looking for doers, integrators, professional hybrids, thinkers, and innovators who can help us achieve our objectives.

We take a product and platform-based approach, we vertically integrate high-rise mass timber building systems, advanced design engineering, automated manufacturing, and parametric software. Through this, we offer breakthrough end-to-end building solutions that can be built faster with better quality while being more affordable and consistently carbon neutral.

We are broadly recognized for our leadership in bringing together climate tech and construction tech solutions, including by Sustainable Development Technology Canada (SDTC), Breakthrough Energy Solutions Canada (BESC) and the Solar Impulse Foundation. We have been named as Foresight50, one of Canada’s most investible clean tech companies, and investors include BDC, Greesoil Proptech Ventures, UIT, and Fulmer, among others.

Intelligent City was co-founded in 2008 by entrepreneurs Oliver Lang and Cindy Wilson and is the sister company to Lang Wilson Practice in Architecture Culture (LWPAC). The two companies work closely together to deliver the vision of productized and platform-based buildings. The LWPAC team has executed award-winning institutional and residential projects both nationally and internationally, with professional experience in Berlin, New York, Barcelona, and Vancouver.

Please note: Architectural employees will be employed by LWPAC.

Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a culture of innovation, diversity, and inclusivity, striving for open discussions, best hiring, and operational practices. We are also committed to providing a comfortable and accessible interview process; please let us know if we can support you throughout the process with accommodations.

Land Acknowledgement

Intelligent City acknowledges that its work takes place in Vancouver on the unceded, traditional, and ancestral territories of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh Úxwumixw (Squamish), and səl̓ilw̓ətaʔɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) peoples and on the unceded, traditional, and ancestral territories of the scəw̓aθən (Tsawwassen), xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), and other Coast Salish peoples at its Delta location.

Title: Lead Data Scientists
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know Our Team

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

The Opportunity

We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.

As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world’s largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.

In This Role, You’ll Get to


Design, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readiness
Mine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovation
Work with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality
Research discover and harness new ideas that can make a difference


What You’ll Need To Succeed


4+ years hands-on data science experience
Excellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworks
Significant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or Scala
Can lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a team
Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment


It’s Great if You Have


PhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fields
Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems
Hands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop
Experience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTA


We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

Show more
HTML:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know Our Team

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

The Opportunity

We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.

As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world’s largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.

In This Role, You’ll Get to

  • Design, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readiness
  • Mine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovation
  • Work with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality
  • Research discover and harness new ideas that can make a difference

What You’ll Need To Succeed

  • 4+ years hands-on data science experience
  • Excellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworks
  • Significant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or Scala
  • Can lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a team
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment

It’s Great if You Have

  • PhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fields
  • Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems
  • Hands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop
  • Experience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTA

We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

Title: Application Engineer
Description:
Application Engineer - Instrumentation and Controls

Location: Delta, BC

The Opportunity

MT Talent is proud to partner with a leading designer, manufacturer and integrator of gas and air quality detection solutions. As they continue to grow and provide solutions to customers globally, they are seeking an energetic and talented Application Engineer to join their team. This role is located in their Detla, BC office and is in in-person position.

The Application Engineer will develop solutions servicing a diverse customer base in the residential, commercial, industrial and institutional sectors. You will review engineering plans, understand the application, design quality systems, create drawings and submittal packages, and then support the customer through installation.

Personality is key for this role, so even if you don’t have experience with all of the above, with the right foundational education and attitude, you will be provided with the training, resources, and support necessary to succeed!

Here’s what you’ll be doing in the role:


Review plans and project specifications received from customers
Design Gas Detection systems for a wide variety of applications and prepare quotes for customers
Create project drawings quotes and submittals packages for dealers and engineers
Provide post-sale technical and installation support for projects you design
Deliver technical training and education to dealers, technicians, and engineers
Share insights with the broader CET team and provide input on product direction


Here’s What You Bring To The Role


Post-secondary degree or diploma in Electrical, Mechanical, Electro-Mechanical, Automation and Robotics, or similar area of Engineering
1 or more years’ experience with instrumentation and controls design work
Experience with gas detection, HVAC, controls and/or instrumentation is preferred
Familiar with building plans and software used to edit building plans
Strong computer skills including MS Office and engineering design software such as AutoCAD, Solidworks, Visio
Excellent written and oral English communication skills
Proven ability to present to a group or individuals, including virtual presentations
A collaborative, team-oriented attitude
Strong attention detail, highly organized and able to complete work to specific deadlines
Analytical with a desire to deliver quality work
A positive, resilient, and curious personality that is eager to grow and learn
Strong written and verbal communication skills with an ability to present to a group in person and/or virtually


Here’s What’s In It For You


Competitive wages and extended benefits package
Wellness spending account
Profit sharing
Retention bonuses
Excellent work culture that is supportive, progressive and fun!
Professional and career development opportunities


#MT1

Title: Full Stack Engineer - 2024 Onboarding
Description:
This posting is intended to create an internal bench for future roles in our engineering team. The interview process will vary slightly but once availability opens up, candidates will be on boarded from the bench in an accelerated process rather than completing an entire recruitment process.
This job is remote-friendly for all candidates


The Role:

As a Frontend-Focused Full Stack Software Engineer, you'll have a pivotal role in developing and supporting client esports campaigns and platform product services, with a strong emphasis on frontend technologies. Your expertise in software development, coupled with your passion for video games, will drive the success of our projects. We value your contribution and are dedicated to supporting your growth, offering new challenges, and providing fair compensation.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and support client and platform projects with a primary focus on frontend technologies, ensuring delivery on time and within budget.
Work closely with client managers, designers, and technical managers to ensure clarity on project scope, breaking down complex tasks into demoable parts aligned with project goals.
Build, test, and demonstrate user stories with a focus on creating engaging and intuitive user interfaces.
Collaborate with backend developers to ensure seamless integration of frontend and backend technologies.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our frontend development practices and standards.


Who You Are:


A talented individual who is deeply passionate about software development and esports.
A team player who cares about their work and is committed to making a positive impact.
Skilled in frontend technologies and eager to bring innovative solutions to the table.


Required Experience and Skills:


At least two-three years of professional team based work experience in full-stack software development, with a strong emphasis on frontend development.
Proficiency in frontend technologies, including JavaScript, CSS, React, and some exposure to TypeScript.
Familiarity with backend technologies such as Node.js, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, with some experience in creating or refining API endpoints, with experience in integrating ready made endpoints.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.


Additional Experience

Having experience in any of the following are a benefit, but not required:


Experience with GitHub Actions and AWS services like CDK, CloudFront, ElasticBeanstalk or ECS, Route 53, S3, Lambda, and CloudWatch.
Familiarity with decoupled CMSs, Storyblok, Contentful or the like
Familiarity with modern frameworks like Nextjs, Remix, Gatsby or the like

Title: Expert Scientist, Dexterous Manipulation
Description:
Job Title: Expert Scientist, Dexterous Manipulation




Introduction: We are currently seeking an Expert Scientist, Dexterous Manipulation to drive forward our pioneering projects in robotic manipulation. This position offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of robotics by developing and applying advanced manipulation techniques.




About the Company: Founded by visionaries from various groundbreaking technology initiatives, our company is at the forefront of creating human-like intelligence in robots to enhance human safety, efficiency, and sustainability. We are recognized globally for our innovative approach to solving complex scientific challenges and our commitment to extending human capabilities through technology, potentially even beyond Earth.




About the Role: As an Expert Scientist, Dexterous Manipulation, you will be integral in developing sophisticated algorithms for robotic hands, enabling nuanced interactions with diverse environments. Your role includes pioneering work in reinforcement learning (RL) and imitation learning (IL), from conceptualization to real-world application. This position offers the chance to work closely with state-of-the-art robotic systems and collaborate with a team dedicated to redefining what is possible in robotic autonomy.




What We Can Offer You:

A competitive salary and benefits package.
Access to cutting-edge technology and equipment.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth.
A collaborative and innovative work environment.
Support for continuous learning and development.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and refine RL and IL algorithms for real-world robotic applications.
Evaluate and enhance the performance of these algorithms in simulated and actual environments.
Lead and contribute to research initiatives that could transform current practices in robotics.
Collaborate across teams to integrate new algorithms and solve complex problems in robotic manipulation.




This role not only demands a deep understanding of ML and AI principles but also a passion for practical, impactful applications in robotics. If you are ready to take on the challenge and lead the way in robotic manipulation, we would like to hear from you.




Relevant Keywords: Expert Scientist, Dexterous Manipulation, robotics, reinforcement learning, imitation learning, algorithm development, robotic autonomy, real-world applications.
